Patient Model

Developer: Mahtab Ahmed

File: models/patient.py

Description

This module handles all database operations related to patients including registration, login verification, and session management.

Class: Patient

class Patient

Patient model class for database operations.

Methods

Patient.create(mysql, full_name, age, gender, phone, email, password, address=None, blood_group=None, emergency_contact=None)

Create a new patient account in the database.

Parameters:

  • mysql – MySQL database connection object

  • full_name – Patient’s full name

  • age – Patient’s age

  • gender – Patient’s gender (Male/Female/Other)

  • phone – Patient’s phone number

  • email – Patient’s email address (unique)

  • password – Plain text password (will be hashed)

  • address – Patient’s address (optional)

  • blood_group – Patient’s blood group (optional)

  • emergency_contact – Emergency contact number (optional)

Returns:

The newly created patient’s ID

Patient.find_by_email(mysql, email)

Find a patient by their email address.

Parameters:

  • mysql – MySQL database connection object

  • email – Email address to search for

Returns:

Patient record if found, None otherwise

Patient.find_by_id(mysql, patient_id)

Find a patient by their ID.

Parameters:

  • mysql – MySQL database connection object

  • patient_id – Patient’s unique ID

Returns:

Patient record if found, None otherwise

Patient.get_all(mysql)

Get all active patients from the database.

Parameters:

mysql – MySQL database connection object

Returns:

List of all active patient records

Patient.verify_password(mysql, email, password)

Verify patient login credentials.

Parameters:

  • mysql – MySQL database connection object

  • email – Patient’s email address

  • password – Plain text password to verify

Returns:

Patient record if credentials valid, None otherwise

Patient.update(mysql, patient_id, **kwargs)

Update patient details in the database.

Parameters:

  • mysql – MySQL database connection object

  • patient_id – Patient’s unique ID

  • kwargs – Fields to update (key=value pairs)

Returns:

True if update successful

Patient.email_exists(mysql, email)

Check if an email address is already registered.

Parameters:

  • mysql – MySQL database connection object

  • email – Email address to check

Returns:

True if email exists, False otherwise

Patient.delete(mysql, patient_id)

Soft delete a patient (set is_active to False).

Parameters:

  • mysql – MySQL database connection object

  • patient_id – Patient’s unique ID

Returns:

True if deletion successful
